description: "Initiate a non-destructive audit of the 'mainpc_code' codebase. Your goal is to identify all potential candidates for cleanup, including orphan files, unused code, and redundant assets. Consolidate all your findings into a single, detailed markdown report named 'cleanup_plan.md'. This report must categorize each item with a proposed action ([DELETE], [REFACTOR], [ARCHIVE]) and provide a clear, evidence-based justification for each proposal. Do not modify or delete any files in this phase."

todos.text: Review the 'mainpc_code' codebase to identify orphan files, unused code segments, and redundant assets
Create a list categorizing each identified item as orphan files, unused code segments, and redundant assets
Develop a markdown template 'cleanup_plan.md' with sections for orphan files, unused code segments, and redundant assets
Populate the markdown template with findings from step one using IF condition: then action logic
For each identified item in the codebase: IF it is an orphan file THEN propose [ARCHIVE], ELSEIF unused, THEN suggest [REFACTOR] (if applicable), OTHERWISE recommend [DELETE]
Write evidence-based justifications for each proposed action within the markdown report
Review and finalize 'cleanup_plan.md' for accuracy and completeness

description: Perform a comprehensive audit of the agent codebase located in 'main_pc_code/', using 'main_pc_code/config/startup_config.yaml' as the manifest of agents to analyze. For each agent, identify and list the following: all coding patterns (naming, structure), all imports (with frequency counts), error handling approaches, and any notable code smells or anti-patterns. Finally, generate a summary table of all observed patterns, highlighting any inconsistencies.
